Part Failure Description: Device's System Board is causing an issue during device re-imaging. Device unable to re-image using PXE boot and USB boot. Tested SSD health and found no issues - healthy. System Board needs replacement.
Incident Report: Device came back from Cell Tech saying that there was a System Update"
column43: and no hardware changes. When opened
column44: the device prompted for the Bitlocker Recovery so DES attempted to reimage. The device will not image
column45: over network or with USB boot. Secure Boot keys were cleared and this made no change."

Incident Report:
Per Student – I accidentally dropped it.

Per DES –Screen damaged. No other visible damage to the device.

Part Failure Description: School claims machine turns on but display not connected." This claim was not accurate; while the system board powers on

column45: Chromebook turns on but display not connected, DES tried to open recovery screen. Possibly faulty connection to display

Part Failure Description: Chromebook has a broken LCD . it was accidently dropped, Needs LCD replacement .
Incident Report: Chromebook has a broken screen. No information was given as to how it happened.

Part Failure Description: User describes accidentally dropping device. LCD is cracked at top right of LCD. No other damage found. Needs Replacement.
Incident Report: Cracked screen. Students accidently dropped his chromebook this morning and the screen cracked causing the touch screen not to work.Student has been advised that if damaged has been deemed as not accidental parents will be financially responsible for the replacement cost per AUP agreement.

Part Failure Description: Device LCD barely visible when on, LCD bezel cracked on left side. Testing with known working LCD fixed issue. LCD and LCD bezel need replacement. The damages are consistent with a drop and show no signs of intentional damage.	, , ,
Incident Report:
Device will not power on. Connected a charger and the LED lights up but it still does not power on. Tried to powerwash but....its not turning on.
I checked the device for additional physical damage; nothing further was observed.
Unknown, intentional, and negligent damage may result in students/parents being responsible for the repair costs.

Part Failure Description: Low Power Charging. Tested with good known chargers along with battery but issue persists. Tested with known good system board and the issue resolved. System board needs replacement.
Incident Report: The Chromebook is not charging past 1%. A working charger has been plugged in, and the power port light is red,but it will not charge the Chromebook. DES is unable to perform a power wash.

Part Failure Description: Users device hit their locker. LCD cracked in top middle, USB-A port not working on I/O board side, and LCD base cover hooks broken in upper right corner. LCD, LCD base cover, and I/O board need replacements.
Incident Report:
329509
Per Student: I have a crack and it won't let the touchscreen work and its clicking buttons. It happened when I was putting it in my locker and it hit the top and cracked.
Per DES: Cracked screen. No other damage observed.

Incident Report: Device loses power rapidly when not plugged in going from full charge to dead in less than an hour while requiring almost 12 hours to fully charge. Unknown, Intentional, and Negligent damage may result in students/parents being responsible for the repair costs

Part Failure Description: LCD touch is inconsistent, keyboard cracked on right side, right hinge cracked, power button jammed. LCD, keyboard, keyboard bezel with trackpad, and hinges need replacement. The damages are consistent with a drop and show no signs of intentional damage.

per student - touch not working, and also not able to click and drag
per ddi - touchscreen was not working when logged in. i was able to use touch prior to logging in. unable to select an item and click and drag

Part Failure Description: Device accidentally knocked off table while charging, charger broke off inside of port, when removed, USB-C port remained damaged. Device cannot charge with current charging port. System board needs replacement.,
Incident Report:
Student's Chromebook has a broken charging port that is not allowing the device to charge. Student was at home yesterday and was charging her Chromebook in her family room when she left to go outside. When she came back, her device was on the floor and the charger's plug was broken off in the device. She brought it to me to have the plug removed from the port, but after I successfully extracted the plug, the device won't charge. Student is unsure of how her Chromebook ended up on the floor, but the fall is what caused the plug to break off while inside the charging port.
Recommendation: replace charging port
No physical damage.

Incident Report: Per Student My chromebook accidentally fell off my desk on accident when I stood up from my chair .
